title: Module 1
description: This quiz covers the basics of investing, including what investing means, why people invest, how returns work, and how investing helps build wealth over time.

questions.question: What does it mean to invest money?
options: To use money to try to make more money
questions.explanation: Investing means putting your money into something—like stocks or businesses—with the goal of helping it grow over time.

questions.question: Why do people invest?
options: To grow their money over time
questions.explanation: People invest so their money can increase in value over time, helping them reach long-term financial goals.

questions.question: What is a “return”?
options: Returning a product to a store
The money you earn from an investment
How fast you can spend money
questions.explanation: A return is the profit or gain you earn from an investment, such as money made from stocks or interest.

questions.question: How can investing help you over time?
options: It can help your money grow
questions.explanation: Investing helps your money grow gradually, increasing its value over the long term and helping you build wealth.

questions.question: Which of these is something you can invest in?
questions.explanation: Stocks are real financial assets that can increase in value, making them a common and effective investment choice.

questions.question: What does “building wealth” mean?
questions.explanation: Building wealth means growing your financial resources over time through saving, investing, and earning.

questions.question: Why is starting early helpful when investing?
options: Because investing only works for kids
Your money has more time to grow
questions.explanation: Investing early gives your money more time to grow through compounding, which can significantly increase long-term returns.
